column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
New employee hires and employee turnover
column7: CBA's voluntary employee turnover in 2023 was 11.2%.

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: CBA's Organisational Culture Plan harnesses programs of work to drive culture change, including risk culture, at all three levels. These include making it easier for CBA's people to deliver the highest impact work for its customers by supporting all teams to understand the impact of their work on customers' experience, helping people strive for simpler, better solutions by continually adapting and learning and embedding a new way to lead.
column20: Organisational Culture Plan, culture change, risk culture

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: CBA provides several employee benefits that can help reduce expenses. For example, staff deals offering discounts on retail products and services, pay advance options for employees struggling to meet everyday expenses, and other savings and benefits.
column20: Employee benefit, reducing expense, pay advance option

column6: Parental leave
column7: CBA had 2,323 employees taking parental leave in 2023.

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Occupation health and safety management system
column13: Employee engagement remains 79% from CBA's most recent Your Voice survey. The results support a continued focus on CBA's values and purpose, diversity, equity and inclusion, and flexible working options as drivers of engagement and people's experience. Important factors in delivering CBA's strategic priorities included stopping the least impactful work, supporting its people's well-being, and providing new skilling opportunities.
column20: Your Voice, diversity, flexible working

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: CBA encourages employees to have regular, motivating and development-focused conversations with their leaders. Check-in conversations occur quarterly to regularly reflect on performance, reset goals, and establish meaningful development opportunities for the next quarter.
column20: Check-in conversation, development-focused conversation, performance

column6: Occupational health services
column13: CBA established a Financial Assistance Solutions team to tailor personalised solutions for its customers and employees. CBA's Employee Assistance Program also has financial coaches to help those experiencing or anticipating financial difficulty.
column20: Employee Assistance Program, personalised solution, financial coach

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: CBA conducted its first Leading Mentally Healthy Workplaces Survey, led by the Corporate Mental Health Alliance Australia. The insights from this survey will be used to inform employee programs and offerings. CBA continues to improve its health and safety systems to identify better and manage psychosocial risk and work-related factors that can impact employees' psychological health and safety, including how work is designed, organised and managed.
column20: Mentally Healthy Workplaces Survey, Corporate Mental Health Alliance Australia, health and safety system

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column7: CBA continues to improve its health and safety systems to identify better and manage psychosocial risk and work-related factors that can impact employees' psychological health and safety, including how work is designed, organised and managed.

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: CBA's Well-being Hub contains resources to help employees manage their finances, such as its 'Financial Well-being for Our People' workbook. The workbook provides simple steps and tools to help build confidence in managing money. Monthly webinars cover budgeting, saving, using employee benefits, controlling debt, and estate planning.
column20: Well-being Hub, workbook, webinar

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: As one of the first organisations to be certified as a Family Friendly Workplace, CBA is proud to be recognised for the depth and breadth of support options for families and carers. It includes a diversity of leave options, such as Sorry Business leave, workplace support for domestic and family violence, resources for LGBTI+ families, aged caring support, well-being guides for new and single parents, and guides to assist with navigating miscarriage, stillbirth and infant loss.
column20: Family Friendly Workplace, leave option, support option

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column7: CBA is committed to creating a positive and supportive workplace that helps its people be their best. It includes creating a mentally healthy workplace where CBA's culture supports those experiencing mental ill-health and provides its people opportunities to thrive.

column6: Work-related injuries
Work-related ill health
column13: CBA continues to embed Respect Lives Here, its key initiative to strengthen respect and prevent harmful behaviours at work, by educating its people on the impact of these behaviours and how to be an active bystander. Quarterly Inclusion Conversations encourage senior leaders to reflect on equitable decision-making and help CBA's people to succeed.
column20: Respect Lives Here, harmful behaviour, decision-making

column6: Average hours of training per year per employee
column7: CBA's average training hours in 2023 was 24.9 hours per employee.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Throughout the year, CBA held training sessions outlining the ESG risk assessment tool process for its business bankers. In the Institutional Bank, all team members must complete ESG fundamentals training. Additional ESG risk assessment tool training is required for frontline bankers and credit risk teams assessing institutional lending transactions.
column20: ESG risk assessment tool, business banker, training

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: For lenders in the Retail Bank, CBA has an eLearning module outlining the products lenders can offer to help customers navigate the transition and detailed conversation guides to provide its lenders with additional support. In addition to online training, CBA's Business Banking team members can attend classroom sessions and webinars that discuss the features of more sophisticated financing options.
column20: eLearning module, product lender, classroom session

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: As part of CBA's new talent attraction campaign, You x CommBank, CBA invites successful candidates to become its partners. A career with CBA means being more than just an employee. CBA is committed to providing opportunities for its people to grow professionally and develop their skills.
column20: You x CommBank, talent attraction, skill

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column13: CBA made significant progress under its APRA Prudential Inquiry Remedial Action Plan to reset its cultural foundations Ã¢ÂÂ renewing the Bank's purpose, values and risk foundations and embedding them throughout the organisation. The changes represent an evolution in how CBA wants to deliver outcomes for customers, communities and each other.

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column13: CBA's recognition programs celebrate colleagues living its values and allow its people to nominate those who have gone above and beyond for Excellence Awards, including a People's Choice Award. This year's People's Choice Award, 'Backing Good Judgement,' was selected to recognise those who exemplify CBA's values by demonstrating the ability and willingness to apply careful judgement and take on the right risks that prioritise good customer outcomes.
column20: People's Choice Award, recognition program, careful judgement

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: In early 2022, the Indigenous Careers team reviewed how CBA might better attract First Nations peoples to the Bank and what, if any, other factors contributed to slower-than-expected progress against its 3% target. This included discussions with Indigenous Partner organisations, CBA leaders and Indigenous Program Managers and listening sessions conducted with First Nations employees. This review provided CBA with extensive and valuable lessons, including that there are opportunities to amplify CBA's talent attraction messaging and expand the channels used to engage candidates.
column20: Indigenous Careers, First Nations, Indigenous Partner

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: The Group Inclusion and Diversity Policy outlines CBA's approach and commitment to inclusion and diversity. The policy states the principles CBA's employees and senior leaders are expected to work towards to deliver a workplace that is safe, accessible and inclusive, where everyone feels valued and respected.
column20: Inclusion and Diversity Policy, respect, safe workplace

column8: Human Rights of First Nations Stakeholders Grievance Process
column13: CBA's Human Rights of First Nations Stakeholders Grievance Process provides a clear channel for First Nations stakeholders to raise grievances with CBA and for CBA to listen to those grievances. Through this process, CBA will consider its connection to a human rights impact and, where appropriate, consider options to resolve or otherwise address the grievance.
